meanings.definition: A person or thing that is very boring or uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The lecture was a real snoozer, putting everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The movie turned out to be a snoozer, with no exciting scenes.
meanings.sent3: The party was such a snoozer that even the music fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The book was a snoozer, each page more boring than the last.
meanings.sent5: The meeting felt like a snoozer marathon, lasting for hours on end.

meanings.definition: A boring or uninteresting event or situation.
meanings.sent1: The long wait at the doctor's office was a real snoozer.
meanings.sent2: The history lesson turned into a snoozer with all the dates and names.
meanings.sent3: The rainy day turned out to be a snoozer, with nothing to do indoors.
meanings.sent4: The party was a snoozer, lacking any fun activities.
meanings.sent5: The museum visit became a snoozer, with each exhibit looking the same.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that puts someone to sleep.
meanings.sent1: The bedtime story was a snoozer, lulling the child to sleep in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The soothing music acted as a snoozer, helping me relax and doze off.
meanings.sent3: The boring documentary turned into a snoozer, making everyone yawn.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous voice of the speaker was a snoozer, causing many to nod off.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rocking of the boat acted as a snoozer, calming the passengers to sleep.
